### computeKnownBits() {#a903bd19e9d31beff55b22fe86111639e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void computeKnownBits (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp; DemandedElts, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownbits">KnownBits</a> &amp; Known, unsigned Depth, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/simplifyquery">SimplifyQuery</a> &amp; Q)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Determine which bits of V are known to be either zero or one and return them in the Known bit set.

NOTE: we cannot consider &#39;undef&#39; to be &quot;IsZero&quot; here. The problem is that we cannot optimize based on the assumption that it is zero without changing it to be an explicit zero. If we don&#39;t change it to zero, other code could optimized based on the contradictory assumption that it is non-zero. Because instcombine aggressively folds operations with undef args anyway, this won&#39;t lose us code quality.

This function is defined on values with integer type, values with pointer type, and vectors of integers. In the case where V is a vector, known zero, and known one values are the same width as the vector element, and the bit is set only if it is true for all of the demanded elements in the vector specified by DemandedElts.

  labels = {["static"]}>
Compute known bits from a shift operator, including those with a non-constant shift amount.

Known is the output of this function. Known2 is a pre-allocated temporary with the same bit width as Known and on return contains the known bit of the shift value source. KF is an operator-specific function that, given the known-bits and a shift amount, compute the implied known-bits of the shift operator&#39;s result respectively for that shift amount. The results from calling KF are conservatively combined for all permitted shift amounts.

  labels = {["static"]}>
Return the number of times the sign bit of the register is replicated into the other bits.

We know that at least 1 bit is always equal to the sign bit (itself), but other cases can give us information. For example, immediately after an &quot;ashr X, 2&quot;, we know that the top 3 bits are all equal to each other, so we return 3. For vectors, return the number of sign bits for the vector element with the minimum number of known sign bits of the demanded elements in the vector specified by DemandedElts.

### lookThroughCast() {#a343ee023c7b7336ca66fd4c296db0feb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Value &#42; lookThroughCast (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst">CmpInst</a> &#42; CmpI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V2, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> &#42; CastOp)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Helps to match a select pattern in case of a type mismatch.

The function processes the case when type of true and false values of a select instruction differs from type of the cmp instruction operands because of a cast instruction. The function checks if it is legal to move the cast operation after &quot;select&quot;. If yes, it returns the new second value of &quot;select&quot; (with the assumption that cast is moved):
<ul>
<li>As operand of cast instruction when both values of &quot;select&quot; are same cast instructions.</li>
<li>As restored constant (by applying reverse cast operation) when the first value of the &quot;select&quot; is a cast operation and the second value is a constant. It is implemented in <a href="#a88b0909bfe0684c1c286237dd9985ce9">lookThroughCastConst()</a>.</li>
<li>As one operand is cast instruction and the other is not. The operands in sel(cmp) are in different type integer. NOTE: We return only the new second value because the first value could be accessed as operand of cast instruction.</li>
</ul>

<Link id="l02954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2954"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Instruction::BitCast: &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2955"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We need to be a bit careful here. We can only peek through the bitcast</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2956"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// if the scalar size of elements in the operand are smaller than and a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2957"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multiple of the size they are casting too. Take three cases:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2958"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2959"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1) Unsafe:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2960"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        bitcast &lt;2 x i16&gt; %NonZero to &lt;4 x i8&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2961"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2962"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    %NonZero can have 2 non-zero i16 elements, but isKnownNonZero on a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2963"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    &lt;4 x i8&gt; requires that all 4 i8 elements be non-zero which isn&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2964"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    guranteed (imagine just sign bit set in the 2 i16 elements).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2965"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2966"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2) Unsafe:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2967"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        bitcast &lt;4 x i3&gt; %NonZero to &lt;3 x i4&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2968"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2969"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    Even though the scalar size of the src (&#96;i3&#96;) is smaller than the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2970"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    scalar size of the dst &#96;i4&#96;, because &#96;i3&#96; is not a multiple of &#96;i4&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2971"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    its possible for the &#96;3 x i4&#96; elements to be zero because there are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2972"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    some elements in the destination that don&#39;t contain any full src</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2973"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    element.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2974"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2975"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 3) Safe:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2976"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//        bitcast &lt;4 x i8&gt; %NonZero to &lt;2 x i16&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02977" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2977"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02978" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2978"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    This is always safe as non-zero in the 4 i8 elements implies</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02979" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2979"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    non-zero in the combination of any two adjacent ones. Since i8 is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02980" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2980"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    multiple of i16, each i16 is guranteed to have 2 full i8 elements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02981" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2981"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    This all implies the 2 i16 elements are non-zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2982"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;FromTy = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;getOperand(0)-&gt;getType();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l09006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9006"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Helps to match a select pattern in case of a type mismatch.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9007"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9008"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The function processes the case when type of true and false values of a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9009"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// select instruction differs from type of the cmp instruction operands because</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9010"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of a cast instruction. The function checks if it is legal to move the cast</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9011"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// operation after &quot;select&quot;. If yes, it returns the new second value of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9012"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &quot;select&quot; (with the assumption that cast is moved):</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9013"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1 As operand of cast instruction when both values of &quot;select&quot; are same cast</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9014"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9015"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 2 As restored constant (by applying reverse cast operation) when the first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9016"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// value of the &quot;select&quot; is a cast operation and the second value is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9017"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// constant. It is implemented in lookThroughCastConst().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9018"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 3 As one operand is cast instruction and the other is not. The operands in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l09019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9019"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// sel(cmp) are in different type integer.</span></CodeLine>
